Cast<S>7971</S> thy bread<S>3899</S> upon<S>6440</S> the waters<S>4325</S>: for thou shalt find<S>4672</S> it after many<S>7230</S> days<S>3117</S>. <sup>upon: Heb. upon the face of the waters</sup>
Give<S>5414</S> a portion<S>2506</S> to seven<S>7651</S>, and also to eight<S>8083</S>; for thou knowest<S>3045</S> not what evil<S>7451</S> shall be upon the earth<S>776</S>.
If the clouds<S>5645</S> be full<S>4390</S> of rain<S>1653</S>, they empty<S>7324</S> themselves upon the earth<S>776</S>: and if the tree<S>6086</S> fall<S>5307</S> toward the south<S>1864</S>, or toward the north<S>6828</S>, in the place<S>4725</S> where the tree<S>6086</S> falleth<S>5307</S>, there it shall be<S>1933</S>.
He that observeth<S>8104</S> the wind<S>7307</S> shall not sow<S>2232</S>; and he that regardeth<S>7200</S> the clouds<S>5645</S> shall not reap<S>7114</S>.
As thou knowest<S>3045</S> not what is the way<S>1870</S> of the spirit<S>7307</S>, nor how the bones<S>6106</S> do grow in the womb<S>990</S> of her that is with child<S>4392</S>: even so thou knowest<S>3045</S> not the works<S>4639</S> of God<S>430</S> who maketh<S>6213</S> all.
In the morning<S>1242</S> sow<S>2232</S> thy seed<S>2233</S>, and in the evening<S>6153</S> withhold<S>3240</S> not thine hand<S>3027</S>: for thou knowest<S>3045</S> not whether<S>335</S> shall prosper<S>3787</S>, either this or that, or whether they both<S>8147</S> shall be alike<S>259</S> good<S>2896</S>. <sup>shall prosper: Heb. shall be right</sup>
Truly the light<S>216</S> is sweet<S>4966</S>, and a pleasant<S>2896</S> thing it is for the eyes<S>5869</S> to behold<S>7200</S> the sun<S>8121</S>:
But if a man<S>120</S> live<S>2421</S> many<S>7235</S> years<S>8141</S>, and rejoice<S>8055</S> in them all; yet let him remember<S>2142</S> the days<S>3117</S> of darkness<S>2822</S>; for they shall be many<S>7235</S>. All that cometh<S>935</S> is vanity<S>1892</S>.
Rejoice<S>8055</S>, O young man<S>970</S>, in thy youth<S>3208</S>; and let thy heart<S>3820</S> cheer<S>2895</S> thee in the days<S>3117</S> of thy youth<S>979</S>, and walk<S>1980</S> in the ways<S>1870</S> of thine heart<S>3820</S>, and in the sight<S>4758</S> of thine eyes<S>5869</S>: but know<S>3045</S> thou, that for all these things God<S>430</S> will bring<S>935</S> thee into judgment<S>4941</S>.
Therefore remove<S>5493</S> sorrow<S>3708</S> from thy heart<S>3820</S>, and put away<S>5674</S> evil<S>7451</S> from thy flesh<S>1320</S>: for childhood<S>3208</S> and youth<S>7839</S> are vanity<S>1892</S>. <sup>sorrow: or, anger</sup>
